meanings.definition: To make (something) appealing or interesting to the general public.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was popularising the new learning method to help students understand better.
meanings.sent2: The company was popularising their new product through social media advertisements.
meanings.sent3: The magician popularising a rabbit as a math tutor was quite a sight!
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter was popularising joy throughout the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist's vibrant colors were popularising happiness in every painting.

meanings.definition: To promote or spread (an idea, trend, etc.) widely among the general public.
meanings.sent1: The celebrity was popularising the importance of mental health awareness.
meanings.sent2: The organization was popularising the concept of recycling to protect the environment.
meanings.sent3: The comedian popularising a joke about clouds raining candy was hilarious.
meanings.sent4: His words were popularising hope like a beacon in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The singer's powerful voice was popularising unity among the audience.
